subject: Sexual Health
title: Identity and Self-Image
description: A fast breakdown of Identity and Self-Image for builders.

hook.text: During puberty, teens begin asking the biggest question of all: Who am I, really?

buildup.text: Physical changes force teens to reckon with a rapidly changing body that may not match their self-image.

discovery.text: Psychologist Erik Erikson called this stage identity versus role confusion, a critical developmental milestone.

twist.text: Social media now adds unprecedented pressure, exposing teens to idealized body standards around the clock.

climax.text: Healthy identity formation during puberty lays the foundation for self-esteem and confidence in adulthood.

punchline.text: Puberty changes the body. Identity shapes the person.

quiz.question: What did Erikson call the teen developmental stage?
